question: I am a 62 yo male and for the last 4 months I have been experiencing numbness in the toes of my right foot. The following is a list of tests and treatments that I have had:Podiatrist #1         Treated me for Neuroma with 2 injections without any reliefI have a Hammer toe on the right foot but Dr did see that as problem.Family Doctor      Tested for Diabetes (normal) Advised that I see a NeurologistPodiatrist #2          Examined me and confirmed that I did not have a Neuroma andLooked at my Hammer Toe but did not see that as a problem. HeRecommended that I see a NeurologistNeurologist           Tested for: Never endings, Vitamin B12, Thyroid and DiabetesAll results were normal. Initial MRI of my Lumbar showed that I hadConsiderable Arthritis in my back. I then had a 2nd MRI of my neckand the results showed that I also had Arthritis in this area. TheNeurologist advised that nothing they had tested should beCausing the numbness in my toes.I am at a lost as to what to do. I have considerable amount of time and money involved in trying to get some relief in my toes. I was aware that I had Arthritis as I had my right hip replaced 13 years ago and will need the left hip replaced in the future.I would appreciate any input as to what I should do next other than just live with it.Paul Mauney
title: Numbness in Toes
